intro: Habracanthus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plants typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce showy, tubular flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red. They are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
